alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 22 at 4:52PM EDT until April 22 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Hunterdon County in northwestern New Jersey... West central Sussex County in northwestern New Jersey... Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... North central Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Eastern Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Eastern Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 452 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Riegelsville, or near Easton, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Easton, Bethlehem, Forks, East Stroudsburg, Wilson, Blairstown, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Alpha, Hope, Belfast, West Easton, Milford, Tatamy, East Bangor, Bloomsbury and Riegelsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 69 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 9. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 308 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 12. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
